products.name: Razer Viper V3 Pro
products.desc: The 2026 Pro Standard. Trusted by the Valorant elite, the Viper V3 Pro weighs in at a surgical 54g. Outfitted with the Focus Pro 35K sensor and native 8K polling, it translates your intent into impact with near-zero latency.
pros: Gravity-defying 54g build ‚Äî heavyweight tech in a featherweight frame.
Bespoke performance: Native 8K polling dongle included right in the box.
The new 'Pro Standard' ‚Äî trusted by the top 1% of the 2026 VCT circuit.
cons: Commanding silhouette: Smaller hands may find the refined hump a bit too 'filling'.
Right-hand biased: Symmetrical shape, but side buttons cater strictly to righties.

products.name: SteelSeries Apex Pro TKL Gen 3
products.desc: The apex of competitive hardware. Re-engineered with OmniPoint 3.0 HyperMagnetic switches, the Gen 3 delivers 20x faster actuation and the brand-new 'Protection Mode' to eliminate misclicks. It's not just a keyboard; it's a tournament-grade unfair advantage.
pros: Surgical responsiveness: OmniPoint 3.0 switches with 0.1mm to 4.0mm adjustable actuation.
Pro-exclusive features: Includes 'Protection Mode' to lower sensitivity on surrounding keys and 'Rapid Tap' for elite counter-strafing.
Premium acoustics: Upgraded triple-layer sound dampening for a more refined, 'thocky' typing experience.
cons: The 'Pro' tax: Even on sale, you are paying a premium for the SteelSeries ecosystem and OLED tech.
Software dependency: To unlock the full potential of Rapid Tap and custom profiles, GG Engine is a must.

products.name: Sennheiser HD 560S
products.desc: The 'Wallhack' for your ears. With surgical directional audio and E.A.R. angled drivers, it offers a neutral soundstage that makes tracking footsteps feel like cheating.
pros: Best-in-class spatial awareness
Ultra-lightweight velour comfort
cons: No built-in mic
Leaks sound (open-back)

products.name: ASUS ROG Strix OLED XG27AQDMG
products.desc: The first of its kind: a 27" glossy WOLED that provides ink-black levels and vibrant colors without the typical matte grain. Features a custom heatsink and ASUS OLED Care to effectively neutralize burn-in risk.
pros: Stunning 3rd Gen WOLED panel with extreme 1300 nits peak brightness.
Glossy finish provides superior clarity and 'pop' compared to matte OLEDs.
Comprehensive 3-year warranty that explicitly covers OLED burn-in.
cons: Reflective surface: Needs controlled lighting to avoid mirror-like glare.
Lacks HDMI 2.1 (uses HDMI 2.0), limiting consoles to 1440p/120Hz.

products.name: AndaSeat Kaiser 4
products.desc: The new king of adjustability. The Kaiser 4 introduces industry-first 6D armrests that tilt and rotate for mobile/handheld gaming, alongside a 4-level 'pop-out' gas-actuated lumbar system that adapts to your spine's natural curve.
pros: Revolutionary 6D armrests: Perfect for supporting your arms while using a phone or Steam Deck.
Pop-out lumbar support: Gas-spring mechanism provides 24¬∞ of extension for deep back relief.
Magnetic cooling pillow: Snap-on memory foam headrest with an integrated cooling gel layer.
cons: Complex assembly: The advanced lumbar and 6D armrest mechanisms make it heavy to put together.
Large footprint: Requires significant floor space compared to slimmer office chairs.

products.name: Endgame Gear OP1w 4K V2
products.desc: The 'Claw King' refined for 2026. German-engineered with a focus on surgical precision, the OP1w 4K V2 features a custom PAW3950 sensor and tactile Kailh GX mechanical switches. It's a narrow, nimble masterpiece built for pure performance over flashy aesthetics.
pros: Unrivaled click feel ‚Äî pre-sorted Kailh GX mechanical switches for peak tactility.
Bespoke customisation: Swappable main switches and internal 'GX Speed Mode'.
Elite tracking: Custom 30K PAW3950 sensor with 750 IPS for flawless flicks.
cons: Specialized shape: The narrow frame and high-back hump are strictly for Claw/Fingertip grips.
Battery trade-off: Permanent 'Corded Mode' tracking limits battery to ~30hrs at 4K.

products.name: ASUS ROG Strix Scope II 96 Wireless
products.desc: The ultimate 'Swiss Army Knife' of keyboards. The Scope II 96 packs full-size utility into a TKL-sized footprint, featuring hot-swappable NX Snow switches and an industry-leading 1,500-hour battery life. It's built like a tank and sounds like a dream.
pros: Elite battery life: Up to 1,500 hours of playtime with lighting off via SpeedNova wireless.
Premium acoustics: Integrated silicone dampening foam and switch pads for a quiet, refined 'thock'.
Versatile controls: Multi-function wheel and button for instant media and lighting tweaks.
cons: Software bloat: Armoury Crate can be resource-heavy for some PC setups.
Non-standard font: The ROG-specific keycap legends might not appeal to minimalists.

products.name: HyperX Cloud III S Wireless
products.desc: Built for the marathon. Features a jaw-dropping 120-hour battery life and HyperX's legendary signature memory foam for a 'cloud-like' fit during long grinds.
pros: Industry-leading battery life
Extremely durable metal frame
cons: Passive noise isolation only
Sound profile is gaming-flat

products.name: AOC Gaming 24G4XE
products.desc: The absolute entry-level king. It shatters the 'budget' stigma by offering a color-accurate Fast IPS panel at 180Hz with G-Sync compatibility for a seamless, tear-free experience.
pros: Fast IPS technology ensures minimal motion blur for high-speed shooters.
G-Sync & Adaptive-Sync support prevents screen tearing even on budget GPUs.
Compact 24" size provides high pixel density (92 PPI) for sharp 1080p visuals.
cons: Basic tilt-only stand: Lacks height, swivel, or pivot adjustments.
HDR10 is entry-level; don't expect 'true' high dynamic range depth.

products.name: Corsair TC100 Relaxed
products.desc: Designed for those who find standard racing chairs too restrictive. The 'Relaxed' series features a wider 375mm seat and subtle bolstering, allowing you to sit cross-legged or lean back in comfort without the 'bucket seat' squeeze.
pros: Roomy design: Broad seat base is much more comfortable for larger frames.
Breathable upholstery: Soft fabric finish prevents the 'sweaty' feeling of cheap PU leather.
Extreme recline: Goes back a full 160¬∞, making it ideal for post-game naps.
cons: Basic 2D armrests: Limited to up/down and side-to-side movement.
External pillows: Uses strap-on lumbar and neck cushions rather than integrated support.

products.name: Razer DeathAdder V3 Pro
products.desc: The icon, perfected for the 2026 circuit. The DeathAdder V3 Pro takes the most successful ergonomic shape in history and strips it down to a 63g competitive frame. It's the 'Executive Suite' of gaming ‚Äî natural, supportive, and relentlessly fast.
pros: World-class ergonomics: A refined, tilted shell designed to eliminate wrist fatigue.
Surgical precision: Focus Pro 30K sensor delivers 99.8% resolution accuracy.
Tank-like reliability: Gen-3 optical switches rated for a massive 90M clicks.
cons: Right-hand exclusive: The aggressive ergonomic slant is strictly for righties.
Size matters: Smaller hands may find the flared front a challenge to grip.

products.name: Aula F99 Wireless
products.desc: The 'Sound King' of 2026. Designed with a gasket-mount structure and five layers of sound-absorbing foam, the F99 delivers a deep, 'creamy' typing experience that rivals keyboards triple its price. It's the enthusiast's choice for those on a budget.
pros: Acoustic perfection: Five-layer dampening and pre-lubed switches provide a world-class sound profile.
Massive capacity: A dual 4000mAh (8000mAh total) battery for weeks of wireless use.
True flexibility: Full hot-swap support for both 3-pin and 5-pin mechanical switches.
cons: Charging speed: The massive battery can take a significant time to reach 100%.
Gamer-Retro vibe: The bold 'Blue & White' colorway is a specific aesthetic choice.

products.name: SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless
products.desc: The ultimate command center. Features an 'Infinity Power' system with two swappable batteries and a base station that swaps between PC and Console instantly.
pros: Never runs out of battery
Simultaneous 2.4GHz & Bluetooth
cons: Very high price point
Internal ANC sensor can touch ears

products.name: AOC Gaming Q27G3XMN
products.desc: The only monitor under ¬£300 that delivers a 'true' HDR experience. With 336 local dimming zones and a peak brightness of 1000 nits, it provides the punchy contrast IPS panels can't touch.
pros: Stunning HDR1000 performance that rivals panels twice its price.
VA panel provides a high native contrast ratio for deep, ink-like blacks.
Mini-LED backlighting significantly reduces 'IPS glow' in dark scenes.
cons: VA Smearing: Fast dark-to-light motion can have slight trailing.
No USB hub or Type-C connectivity: A strictly video-focused display.

products.name: Sihoo Doro C300
products.desc: A medical-grade approach to gaming. The Doro C300 features the 'Domino' dynamic lumbar system that maintains contact with your lower back at all times, even when reclining. It is a posture-correcting powerhouse for serious desk users.
pros: Superior lumbar tech: The support panel moves vertically and horizontally with your spine.
Pressure relief: 'Waterfall' seat edge prevents leg numbness by improving circulation.
High-end mesh: Premium elasticity ensures the seat won't sag after years of use.
cons: Weight limit: Lower 136kg (300lb) capacity compared to heavy-duty gaming tanks.
Industrial look: More 'Silicon Valley Office' than 'Pro Gamer Cave'.

products.name: Logitech G502 X Plus
products.desc: The 'Heavyweight Champion' of versatility. Redesigned with Lightforce hybrid switches and the iconic dual-mode infinite scroll wheel, the G502 X Plus is the ultimate command center for those who refuse to choose between elite gaming and total productivity.
pros: Maximum utility: 13 programmable buttons including a reversible/removable DPI shift.
Tactile precision: Lightforce hybrid switches offer optical speed with a mechanical feel.
Endless endurance: Up to 130 hours of battery life (lighting off) and Powerplay wireless charging support.
cons: Weight class: At 106g, it's significantly more 'planted' than competitive FPS-specific mice.
Bold aesthetic: The 8-zone RGB and aggressive shape might be too loud for minimalist setups.

products.name: Keychron Q1 Max Wireless
products.desc: The 'Endgame' 75% layout. Crafted from a solid block of 6063 aluminum, the Q1 Max adds 2.4GHz wireless and a double-gasket design to the world's most popular enthusiast board. It doesn't just sit on your desk; it anchors it.
pros: Indestructible build: A heavy, precision-machined aluminum chassis that eliminates all rattle.
Superior tactility: Pre-lubed Gateron Jupiter Banana switches offer a unique, early-bump feel.
Enthusiast acoustics: Upgraded with IXPE and Latex foams for a deep, marble-like sound profile.
cons: Substantial weight: At over 1.7kg, this is a permanent desk fixture, not a travel companion.
Battery trade-off: The 4000mAh battery is solid, but RGB usage will require weekly charging.

products.name: Bose QuietComfort Ultra Gen 2
products.desc: Absolute silence. The Gen 2 update adds wired lossless USB-C support and 'Cinema Mode' spatial audio, making it the perfect hybrid for gaming and travel.
pros: Unmatched noise cancellation
New lossless wired support
cons: Most expensive in the lineup
Battery required for wired use

products.name: MSI MAG 274UPDF E16M
products.desc: A 'Shape-Shifter' monitor. Use the 4K 160Hz mode for creative work and immersive RPGs, or flip to 'Dual-Mode' 1080p at a blistering 320Hz for professional-grade esports performance.
pros: AI Dual Mode: High resolution for work, high refresh for competition.
Mini-LED with 1,152 dimming zones offers pinpoint HDR precision.
Rapid IPS panel ensures a 0.5ms response time with zero ghosting.
cons: USB-C is only 15W Power Delivery ‚Äî not enough to charge most laptops.
HDR1000 on IPS can still show minor blooming around small bright objects.

products.name: EUREKA Typhon Gaming Chair
products.desc: The 'anti-heat' solution. Using a full-body CloudSilk mesh, the Typhon keeps you cool during 12-hour sessions while the 'G-Force Equalizer' seat base automatically distributes your weight to prevent pressure points.
pros: Zero heat trap: Full mesh seat and backrest provide maximum airflow.
Adaptive support: The split-back design moves with you as you twist and turn.
Esports aesthetic: Delivers ergonomic benefits without losing the 'gaming' look.
cons: Firm sit: Mesh doesn't have the 'sink-in' plushness of foam chairs.
Dust magnet: The underside of mesh seats can collect dust over time.

products.name: ATK VXE MAD R+ (White)
products.desc: The 'Viper Killer' evolved. The MAD R+ delivers flagship performance with a dual-mode 8K polling rate and an upgraded 500mAh battery. It's a 42g featherweight powerhouse that offers tournament-grade specs without the 'big brand' tax.
pros: Unbeatable value: Flagship sensor and 8K polling for under ¬£50.
Upgraded endurance: 500mAh battery provides significantly more playtime than the standard R model.
Premium feel: Features a smooth 'Ice-feel' coating that stays grippy during intense sessions.
cons: Thin-shell compromise: The ultra-light build lacks the structural 'heft' of more expensive rivals.
Web-based software: Configuration relies on an online driver which may not suit every user.

products.name: Keychron C3 Pro
products.desc: The ultimate gateway to mechanical keyboards. For under ¬£40, the C3 Pro offers a premium gasket-mount structure and full QMK/VIA programmability ‚Äî features usually reserved for boards triple its price.
pros: Unbeatable value: The cheapest way to get a genuine gasket-mount typing experience.
Fully programmable: Use QMK/VIA to remap every single key and layer via your browser.
Gaming ready: 1000Hz polling rate and N-Key Rollover ensure zero ghosting during play.
cons: Wired only: No Bluetooth or 2.4GHz options available (fixed USB-C).
Aesthetic limits: Currently only available with a red-only backlight and black/red keycaps.

products.name: Razer BlackShark V2 X
products.desc: The budget king. Replaces the old A10 by offering superior 50mm drivers and advanced passive noise cancellation in a featherweight, comfortable chassis.
pros: Elite mic clarity for the price
Excellent sound for FPS gaming
cons: Fixed, non-detachable cable
Plastic-heavy construction

products.name: Samsung Odyssey G80SD
products.desc: A hybrid powerhouse. This 32" QD-OLED masterpiece features a matte finish to kill reflections and includes TizenOS Smart TV apps, allowing it to function as a standalone streaming hub.
pros: QD-OLED tech delivers the widest color gamut and pure whites in the 4K space.
Dynamic Cooling system uses pulsating heat pipes to prevent overheating.
Includes AI Upscaling to make lower-resolution content look native 4K.
cons: Matte coating can slightly 'gray out' black levels in very bright rooms.
TizenOS menu system can feel bloated for users who just want a monitor.

products.name: noblechairs HERO
products.desc: Designed in collaboration with esports professionals. The HERO is a sturdy, wide-base chair featuring a built-in dial-adjustable lumbar system (no pillows needed) and a firm cold-cure foam that maintains its shape for a decade.
pros: Integrated support: Use a side dial to adjust lumbar depth ‚Äî no more slipping pillows.
Professional build: Solid steel frame and reinforced aluminum base support up to 150kg.
Sophisticated style: Minimalist stitching makes it look perfect for streamers and executives alike.
cons: Firm seating: It is designed for posture, so it may feel 'stiff' at first if you prefer soft sofas.
4D arms are standard: Doesn't have the extreme upward tilt of the newer Kaiser 4.
